New Records: Germany opened with their biggest victory in Euros history.
Florian Wirtz became Germany’s youngest Euros goal-scorer at 21.
Key Match Events: Kai Havertz scored a penalty after Ryan Porteous was sent off.
Jamal Musiala scored Germany’s second goal.
Niclas Füllkrug scored a thunderbolt into the top right corner.
Emre Can scored Germany’s fifth goal in stoppage time.
Scotland’s Ryan Porteous was shown a red card.
Germany’s Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany captain İlkay Gündoğan expressed confidence before the game.
Pre-tournament title expectations of the Germans were underwhelming after they crashed out of their last three major tournaments.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann praised the team's performance.
Scotland coach Steve Clarke acknowledged the team's poor performance and expressed hope for improvement in the next games.
Emre Can reflected on his unexpected call-up and goal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Late German soccer great Franz Beckenbauer was honored before the match.
The capacity crowd included German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier, Scotland First Minister John Swinney, and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán.
